title: Recreations of Christopher North, Volume 2
author: Wilson, John
snippet: About an hour ago did we, standingon the very beautiful bridge of Perth, see that identical salmon, withhis back-fin just visible above the translucent tide, arrowing up theTay, bold as a bridegroom, and nothing doubting that he should spend hishoneymoon among the gravel-beds of Kinnaird or Moulinearn, or the rockysofas of the Tummel, or the green marble couches of the Tilt.

title: Recreations of Christopher North, Volume 2

title: Leaves from the journal of our life in the Highlands, from 1848 to 1861.
author: Victoria
snippet: Moulinearn we tasted some of the "Athole brose," which was brought to the carriage.

title: Leaves from the journal of our life in the Highlands, from 1848 to 1861 :
author: Victoria
snippet: At Moulinearn we tasted some of the "Atholebrose," which was brought to the carriage.
